title: Fodlan's New Dream
opening: A military force bearing the Crest of Flames on its banner marches west to Garreg Mach from Shambhala, attacking nearby cities along the way. Rhea informs the Alliance that the enemy's general is none other than the ancient Fell King Nemesis. And so the Alliance army prepares for their final battle, hoping to put an end to Fódlan's blood-stained history.

Shambhala has fallen, but a mysterious army has emerged from its ruins, bearing the Crest of Flames on its banner. Leading this force is Nemesis, the King of Liberation, presumed dead for a thousand years.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: I am happy to see you two…

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Sorry to interrupt your rest. But there are some things that we absolutely must ask you.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: It seems I do not have much time left. I do not intend to hide anything any longer.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Rhea… I have to ask. You're the Immaculate One, aren't you? If what I'm thinking is correct, that's what the children of the goddess is referring to. In other words, you—

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: I am the last child of the progenitor god. A long time ago, the progenitor god came from somewhere far away and descended upon this continent. She changed her form to resemble that of a human, and gave her own blood to birth her children. The progenitor god and her children shared knowledge and skills with the people of the land. Together, they built a prosperous civilization. But the humans turned their backs on the teachings of the progenitor god and engaged in senseless wars. Eventually people began to think of themselves as gods and challenged the progenitor god herself to battle. The land was scorched in the war that ensured and the majority of humans were annihilated. I believe that those who slither in the dark are the descendants of those who retreated beneath the ground during that time.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: So they had been waiting all that time for their chance at revenge…

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: It took the progenitor god an astonishing amount of time to revive the ravaged world. But eventually, the continent found peace again, and the progenitor god, having fulfilled her duty, fell into a long slumber in the Holy Tomb. The children who stayed behind built a settlement in Zanado to protect the Holy Tomb as they quietly lived out their lives. But then…Nemesis appeared, bringing tragedy along with him. Even now I cannot forget the sight…of that massive canyon, painted red with blood… I was never able to forgive those who proudly wielded weapons crafted from the corpses of my brethren. I was the only survivor of Zanado, and all I could do was wander across Fódlan clinging to my desperate desire for revenge. I called myself Seiros, fostered the founding of the Empire, and prepared to oppose Nemesis and his followers.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Unbelievable…

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: I put Zanado behind me to gather the remaining children who were scattered across Fódlan… Finally, we killed Nemesis on the Tailtean Plains, and I took back the Sword of the Creator.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Let me get this straight… Saint Seiros…is you?! You're kidding me, right?

dialogue.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
dialogue.line: Professor. Claude. There's something you need to hear right away…

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: If you have something to report, do so at once. There is no need to let my presence worry you.

dialogue.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
dialogue.line: As you wish… We're receiving a constant stream of express messengers from cities to the east. They claim that an unidentified military force is attacking and that there have already been a large number of casualties.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: What?!

dialogue.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
dialogue.line: The reports indicate that the cities and towns along the East Gronder Thoroughfare in the old Hrym territory have already been destroyed. Some villages were razed completely, leaving no survivors…

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Damn it! Did they come from Shambhala? Could it be that there were some remnants of that wicked group hiding there?

dialogue.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
dialogue.line: I have a report! The unidentified military force has crossed the Great Bridge of Myrddin! Alliance forces met them in battle, but it seems they have already broken through!

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: They've already made it so far. Is Count Gloucester unharmed?

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: The count is fine, but apparently my brother joined with reinforcements and was gravely injured…

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: You mean to tell me they easily got past a general as skilled as Holst?

dialogue.speaker: Hilda
dialogue.line: They say the enemy general has a weapon that resembles the Sword of the Creator. Even my brother was powerless to stop him…

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: The Sword of the Creator?

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: That's not possible…

dialogue.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
dialogue.line: The enemy forces are flying a banner bearing the Crest of Flames as they continue their march west along the Airmid River.

dialogue.speaker: Knight Of Seiros
dialogue.line: We believe they're marching toward Garreg Mach. We are preparing to meet them in battle.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: A weapon that resembles the Sword of the Creator… and banner bearing the Crest of Flames… There is only one explanation. The one leading the enemy force…is Nemesis himself.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: Nemesis? That Nemesis? Do you really think the ancient King of Liberation has been brought back to life?

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Perhaps the seal was broken when Shambhala fell… An incredible power that we children cannot hope to match dwells within the blood of the progenitor god. Nemesis obtained that blood, so it would not surprise me if that were the case.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: The blood of the progenitor god… That's right, he did take the remains from the Holy Tomb, didn't he…

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: From the blood of the progenitor god, Sothis, he acquired the Crest of Flames. From her bones and heart, he crafted the Sword of the Creator.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: The Sword of the Creator is made from her bones and heart?

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: The heart of Sothis is the Crest Stone that was placed in the Sword of the Creator. The same is true of the Crests of the 10 Elites and the other Crest Stones… They were born of the blood and hearts of the progenitor god's children. Those who slither in the dark created them. Stole them. Sothis never gifted that power to the humans.

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: The Crests of the 10 Elites, the Crest Stones, and the Heroes' Relics… I can't believe those who slither in the dark made them all. And after that, Nemesis used the Sword of the Creator to massacre all of the progenitor god's children in Zanado… In other words, the citizens of Zanado were killed by weapons made from the remains of their brethren… How atrocious. But I don't get it… The Sword of the Creator that Teach wields doesn't have a Crest Stone. So how is Teach able to wield its full power?

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: The Crest Stone of the progenitor god…dwells within your professor.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: After I battled with Nemesis as Saint Seiros, I reclaimed the heart of Sothis. I wanted to use that heart to…resurrect her. Even though I had to do some…questionable things to achieve that goal, I wished to see Sothis…my mother…once more.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: You placed her heart in me?

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: Yes. I believed that if I could resurrect my mother, I could regain all that had been lost…

dialogue.speaker: Claude
dialogue.line: So…that's the truth of it.

dialogue.speaker: Rhea
dialogue.line: I suspected that your body housed the consciousness of Sothis. Those suspicions were correct. And yet, she merely gave you her power and vanished… My dearest wish did not come true… But you did inherit the power of the progenitor god. Now, you must use that power to defeat Nemesis once and for all. Fódlan's blood-stained history…must end.

conversation.speaker: Claude
conversation.line: Huh… What a magnificent tale! It's enough to make your head spin. Rhea's real identity is Saint Seiros, and the one who attacked us was Nemesis, the King of Liberation! On top of that, you've got the heart of the goddess in you! My flabber is completely gasted right now. But now isn't the time for standing around in disbelief. Nemesis has made it this far for a reason. If we aren't victorious, that's it for Fódlan's new dawn. The world will forever be shrouded in darkness… This is the final, FINAL battle. Finally. My friend… Please give it your all out there!

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: A sudden invasion from Nemesis has plunged the Alliance territories into complete disarray. Against such overwhelming strength, my father and his forces had no choice but to retreat.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Wise decision.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm glad he's survived.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: It was certainly prudent for him to avoid a fruitless death. But as things stand, he will not leave much of an impression on history. So that falls to me. I will do all that I can—for the future of Fódlan, and the glory of House Gloucester!

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Hey, Professor! Have you heard from Claude? He says he's gonna throw a feast if we win the next battle! Enough food to clean out the stores!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That sounds great!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: So what?

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: So I'm super motivated to win! I'm gonna train every muscle I got! I'm coming for you, Nemesis! I'm coming for you, feast!

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: I got the gist of it from Claude. Those who slither in the dark… They seem to be descended from humans who were forced deep underground after the goddess defeated them.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's what I heard.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Is that right?

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: They were trying to wipe out the goddess and her followers in hopes of taking back the surface. That's why they called themselves saviors. To their mind, they were.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: It seems there are some Shambhala loyalists in Nemesis's forces. As long as they're around, we can expect them to continue with their cruel experiments.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We must win.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Let's wipe them out, then.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: Yes. We have to. It's the only way to ensure nobody else will go through what I went through. We must obliterate them in the next battle. It's the only recompense for Edelgard's death.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Just when we thought we'd made it to the end, another enemy approaches… Can we be sure this battle is the last one?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't know.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Of course, there's no way to really know what will happen.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: This is it, I think.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: I think you're right.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: Just a little further to the end. Come on, Professor. We have to win!

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: My big brother challenged Nemesis. He knew he couldn't win. He just did it so that his friends could escape. He emerged from the battle with a terrible injury. It's a miracle he didn't die.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm glad he made it.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Yeah. Me too.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That was so noble of him.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Well, maybe he should have been a little less noble. When you're dead, you're dead.

conversation.speaker: Hilda
conversation.line: Dying to save someone else…seems to defeat the purpose. I wouldn't do it. He's alive, and in spite of myself, I'm really proud of him.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: So, we're defending Fódlan's future, huh? Kind of makes my mercenary ambitions feel pretty small. So I'll think about my promise to Captain Jeralt to protect you instead. That'll be my reason to fight.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That works.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: If I can get you through this in one piece, that's just as good as defending Fódlan's future, isn't it? I just hope he's watching.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: The javelins of light that destroyed Fort Merceus… They are what destroyed Shambhala. They were trying to shroud the city in darkness. Perhaps they were planning to swallow us up in that same darkness. Maybe the javelins of light were a signal to Nemesis. To awaken him from his long slumber. What do you think, Professor?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I think you're exactly right.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Yes, indeed. I have done some good pondering here.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I think you're way off the mark.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: Oh! Really? Hm. Maybe I got a couple of things wrong, but I thought I was pretty close…

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: If we keep up this momentum, we will be able to take down Nemesis and restore peace in Fódlan.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: When you think of it, as one approaches the end of a war, the sacrifices only grow larger, don't they? The winning side musters their forces and attempts to strike a decisive blow... While those of the losing side make desperate attempts to turn the war in their favor. Neither side will give. I only wish we'd consider those who lose their lives in that struggle.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We're far from being safe ourselves.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Yes, exactly my point. Let's be careful to ensure we don't lose our lives, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's a necessary sacrifice.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Perhaps, but that doesn't make it any easier to accept your own survival depends on a throw of the dice.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: It's better than dragging the war out.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: I can appreciate that, but just because a choice is better does not mean that it's good.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Everyone in Fódlan's united, but the Whatstheirfaces in the Dark or whatever won't let up! Let's get rid of 'em right away!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Let's do it.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: We gotta get some training in so we can crush 'em!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We can't let our guard down.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: I know that! Come on, let's go train so we can crush 'em!

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: There's not a lot of time, but I'm afraid we won't win if we don't train!

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: The King of Liberation? The Fell King? His name is Nemesis, right? And he was hidden away for over a thousand years. Wow, that's a really long time all to himself… But that doesn't make him worth admiring, no matter how much I envy him!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You really envy him?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You'd like to be shut away for a thousand years?

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Um. Maybe. Is that a trick question?

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: I keep thinking the war is near its end, then it isn't... When can we finally put this dreadful war behind us?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Let's end it with the next battle.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: That would be wonderful. Imagine, the last moment of combat...then peace. It sounds like a fairy tale. I want to make this a world a place where there is no fighting, where children can grow up happy and safe.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: There can be no end to war.

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: I suppose you're right... But we should still try our best to make the world a place where children can grow up happy and safe.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I can feel a weight in the air. It is different from before. I do not know this Nemesis person, except what I have been reading. But I am not of Fódlan. My knowledge of this person is very little. Even so, I feel that...I can understand it. I know that our enemy has great strength. I am...feeling great fear for this battle.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Don't worry.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: I have belief in you, Professor. Together, we will not be losing.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm scared too.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: You have fear too? You do not look like you do... I have gratitude... I mean, I am grateful that you told me.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: The Fell King Nemesis. Hmph. I imagine he'll be a worthy opponent. How many foes have tasted my blade? He will be an excellent finale. We will be victorious, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Yes, we will!

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Splendid. Let's do it.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Calm down.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: I'm perfectly calm, thank you.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: The King of Liberation wakes after a thousand-year slumber. Feels like I'm living a nightmare.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I feel the same way.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: You too? I hope you're not following my lead on this one, Professor!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We must accept it.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: I know you're right, but it still doesn't feel real.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: Maybe this Nemesis who's attacking us isn't even the real thing. Either way, the damage and death he's causing are real enough. I will fight to protect those who need it.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Just when we think we're in the clear, the legendary Fell King resurrects. Who'd have thought it? Can you handle this getting any weirder? I don't know if I can.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I can sympathize with you.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: I don't know how much of this Nemesis guy is a legend and how much is true, but I know this...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: No time for complaining.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: I want to− I'm going to survive. I've spent this whole war afraid I'd die. Not anymore. I'm going to live.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: I mean, I'll still fight like I want to die because that's worked so far, and why change at this late date, right?

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: And if I'm right and I don't die, would you go have dinner with me sometime?

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: We went through all that trouble to finish the war, and now we have to fight again? What does this Nemesis fellow have against Garreg Mach anyway?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: A vendetta...

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: A vendetta against Garreg Mach? That doesn't make much sense at all.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I have no idea...

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: Well, it doesn't make much sense to me either.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: At any rate, I'll do what I can to defend the monastery and Lady Rhea.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Is Lady Rhea OK? She was quite weakened to start, and then she took all those heavy injuries… I don't want to imagine it, but what will happen if Lady Rhea passes away like this?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We'll cross that bridge if we come to it.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: I suppose you're right.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm sure she'll be fine.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Yes. I'm praying every day that she'll get as well as soon as possible.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Come what may, we should all combine our talents and defend the peace of Fódlan!

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Shambhala is destroyed. But are they vanquished entirely, I wonder… Just as Kronya took Monica's form, perhaps there are some others living above ground.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't know.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Quite possibly.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Once this battle is over, I still have much to see to. But right now, I should focus on the task at hand. On Nemesis. As long as Nemesis stands, both my future and the future of Fódlan hang in the balance.

conversation.speaker: Seteth
conversation.line: Before the monastery was completed, there was a massive battle on the Tailtean Plains. In that battle, the warrior Seiros defeated the Fell King Nemesis and reclaimed the bones and heart of Sothis. Those make up the divine sword that you wield, and the Crest that you bear. Now, Rhea…Seiros…lies helpless. The only one who can defeat this so-called King of Liberation is the inheritor of divine power. You have our full and unwavering support. Only you can do this. Please, save this world.

conversation.speaker: Flayn
conversation.line: Please keep quiet. Rhea is sleeping right now. She does not appear to be very well. I beg of you, please do everything you can to prevent an assault from Nemesis.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Shambhala… An underground city with an entirely different lineage than the goddess? Shame phenomena, driven by a source totally alien to the Crests that we understand. Most unsettling! Could it be magic? Some manner of technology? I would like to know the truth of it all. Very much so. I want to know their history, their knowledge. Why do you suppose they chose this place to occupy?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Well, I don't know.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: I intend to carry out multiple excavations around the city. There is so much to learn! Yet first we face battle with a king who has defied time. Hmm, yes. The excavations can wait, I think.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Life can be tough, you know? But if you've got your friends to help you through, it can be a lot easier. Maybe you butt heads sometimes…but that's OK. That's how you build bonds, right? And I've got friends, Professor. Plenty of those. It's true love that seems to have passed me by.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You should relax.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Relax? I'm relaxed.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: There's still hope.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: But where is my true love to be found? Where is my ray of hope?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Time to give up?

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: Yeah… I'm starting to figure that's the most realistic option.

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: At this point, I'm just hoping you stay single too. Then at least we can share each other's misery!

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: We thought we'd taken down the mastermind of this war, and then the Fell King Nemesis shows up! Well, no matter what evil creatures we have to face, this old soul will keep defending Garreg Mach. Not only Garreg Mach. Also Lady Rhea. Also you. I think Jeralt would be saying the same kind of thing if he were here right now.

conversation.speaker: Catherine
conversation.line: I try not to think about what would happen if Lady Rhea were harmed. I can't bear the thought of it. I'm not sure why the Fell King Nemesis picked right now to come back to life. But it makes me angry, that's for sure! Let's kick him back down into the dirt, where he belongs.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: Ghosts rising up from the ancient ruins… Heh… No matter how hard we push back, they don't stop coming. They're persistent. I'll give them that.

conversation.speaker: Cyril
conversation.line: I hear some super strong and evil fellas are after Lady Rhea. She just barely made it back to Garreg Mach, and then this has to go and happen? I'll protect Lady Rhea as best I can, and you're gonna do the same thing, aren't ya, Professor? Yeah, I know you will! Cut 'em down, Professor! Get every last one of those guys!

conversation.speaker: Judith
conversation.line: Did you hear? Our enemy is Nemesis. Unbelievable. It sounds so crazy, but there's no laughing it off. We must make our move before they reach the monastery.

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Professor! I just have to say thanks! For everything! I'm on high alert today, so don't you worry about a thing. This mysterious military force approaching Garreg Mach… Is it true that Nemesis is with them?! It was Nemesis who led the 10 Elites against Saint Seiros. It's the stuff of legend. But this time, he won't have the 10 Elites on his side. Right? He won't, right?!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: What's the plan, my friend?

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: We will defeat Nemesis.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I thought you'd say that. And of course, I'll be joining you. What about the rest of you? Our enemy is a monster of legend. As always, there's not a shred of proof that we can win.

intro.speaker: Lorenz
intro.line: A foolish inquiry, Claude. I must finish what my father started…

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: Started? Your father ran away before the battle even began.

intro.speaker: Lorenz
intro.line: I…well. All the more reason why I, as his heir, cannot flee now!

intro.speaker: Hilda
intro.line: I'm in. I need to get back at him for hurting my brother. I'm not going to let him get away with it!

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: Wow… Hilda's serious about this!

intro.speaker: Lysithea
intro.line: I too will fight until the end. I wish to protect Fódlan's future.

intro.speaker: Leonie
intro.line: I feel the same as Lysithea. It would hardly be fitting for Captain Jeralt's apprentice to bow out now. I'll show them everything he taught me.

intro.speaker: Marianne
intro.line: I…I will give it my all as well! For the professor, for Claude, and for all of you who helped make me as strong as I am now!

intro.speaker: Raphael
intro.line: I'm in too! And when we're done, I'm gonna eat tons of steak to celebrate!

intro.speaker: Ignatz
intro.line: This truly is the final battle… At this point, you shouldn't have to ask, Claude. You know we're with you.

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I do know that, Ignatz. But I had to ask just to make sure.

intro.speaker: Judith
intro.line: Heh. Look at how reliable you kids have become. You've trained them well, Professor. This Nemesis guy should be arriving soon. Is everyone ready?

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: It's finally time.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I won't let us lose.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: I won't let any of you die.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Let's win this… Together!

intro.speaker: Claude
intro.line: I'm on board with that. Let's all make it through this alive. Let's defeat this dusty old King of Liberation and put an end to this history of lies. Once we've done that, there'll be nothing holding us back. A new and brighter age will begin. Let's go, my friend! Fódlan's new dawn awaits!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Nemesis is here…and with more soldiers than expected.

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: A swamp, huh? But there’s something about it… It looks odd somehow.

battle.speaker: Agarthan Soldier
battle.line: Agh! Can’t…breathe…

battle.speaker: Odesse
battle.line: He should not have done that… Be careful. The water is poisonous to the living.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: It looks like we’d better not get near that swamp… Try to avoid it during the fight!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Huh?! I think they’ve got some sort of magical link with Nemesis…

battle.speaker: Marianne
battle.line: Could the magic be protecting him?

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Not sure, but we’d better take out his 10 commanders before taking him on.

battle.speaker: Nemesis
battle.line: Seiros! I will kill you! Do not get in my way!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: So, that's Nemesis… You're a crusty old bastard, you know that?

battle.speaker: Nemesis
battle.line: All those who stand in my way…will be destroyed!

battle.speaker: Raphael
battle.line: Wah! Watch out, Claude! They're coming for us!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: No effect!? So Nemesis is... invincible...

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Nine more commanders remaining… We just killed number 10. These can’t be the 10 Elites, can they? Nah, not likely.

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: Look! The swampland cleared!

battle.speaker: Lorenz
battle.line: Professor! Claude! All the subordinates to Nemesis have been eliminated!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: It took some doing, but now’s our chance to face off against Nemesis!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Agh! Demonic Beasts flying in from the south… Someone here must be able to summon them!

battle.speaker: Lysithea
battle.line: I sense an unusual presence. Someone may be hiding there.

battle.speaker: Odesse
battle.line: Argh... Thales!

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Now he can’t call any more Demonic Beasts. Time to see off his allies.

battle.speaker: Claude
battle.line: Now he can’t call any more Demonic Beasts. And the remaining forces of Shambhala have been defeated too.

battle.speaker: Ignatz
battle.line: Whoa. The swampland vanished.

battle.speaker: Hilda
battle.line: Look! The swampland cleared!

boss.speaker: Nemesis
boss.line: That sword… You bear the Crest of Flames, just as I do!

end.speaker: Claude
end.line: That one seemed to work… We’re almost done! Let’s go, my friend.

cutscene.speaker: Claude
cutscene.line: Tough talk from a guy who's lived too long. Allow me to fix that!

cutscene.speaker: Nemesis
cutscene.line: You are all pathetic weaklings! You lack the courage to challenge me in lone combat.

cutscene.speaker: Claude
cutscene.line: Yet we have the strength to scale the walls between us, to reach our hands in friendship, so we can open our true hearts to one another!

cutscene.speaker: Claude
cutscene.line: Future historians will refer to this day as the new dawn of Fódlan. Of that, I have no doubt.

cutscene.speaker: Claude
cutscene.line: It's up to you now Teach. As for my path...

narration: A rising flame was alight as the flow of time carved a new history for Fódlan. The ambitions of the Fell King Nemesis were crushed, averting what could have been the greatest crisis in the history of Fódlan. After 5 and a half years of war, a new age was set to begin. Country, faith, history...All that had once formed the order of the world was wiped clean. The heroes whose very hands saved Fódlan from a dark fate commenced with the building of a new society. The leaders of this new unified Fódlan began their walk down a seemly endless path-one toward a world that would cherish differences in race and belief, one where all life would be valued equally. Those clung to the hope that their path would not end with Fódlan—that it would someday span the seas to Dagda and beyond the Throat to Almyra...
